intro: Crepinella longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled crepinella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Siberia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. Crepinella longistyla is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
